section.title: Description
section.p: Medicare Part D provides prescription benefits in several "stages", including an Initial Coverage Benefit Stage, the Coverage Gap or Out-of-Pocket Benefit Stage, and the Catastrophic Coverage Benefit Stage. This class identifies the number and dollar amount of payments made in each stage.

stentry.p: "The amount of claim allocated to the Medicare stage identified by the Benefit Stage Qualifier" - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 393-MW, Data Dictionary 201104).

"Code qualifying the Benefit Stage Amount" - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 393-MV, Data Dictionary 201104). Possible values include: Deductible; Initial Benefit; Coverage Gap (donut hole); Catastrophic Coverage; Not paid under Part D, paid under Part C benefit (for MA-PD plan); Not paid under Part D, paid as or under a supplemental benefit only; Part D drug not paid by Part D plan benefit, paid by the beneficiary under plan-sponsored negotiated pricing; Non-Part D drug not paid by Part D plan benefit, paid by the beneficiary under plan-sponsored negotiated pricing.
